sentences: Tüdruk ütlesid, et ta tuleb homme.
Lapsed ütlesid teistsuguse vastuse kui oodati.
context: The word 'ütlesid' is the past tense (2nd person plural) of the Estonian verb 'ütlema', which means 'to say' or 'to tell'. It specifically refers to what multiple people said in the past. The singular form would be 'ütles' for one person, and other forms include 'ütlen' (I say), 'ütled' (you say - singular), etc.
